poem.title: Ding Ding
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: When rhyme is a loop And reason a circle When nothing at work'll Work out for the coop- er of verse in the hoop Of routine, in the murk of Loch Gloom with the snorkel Bunged up, don't say "bloop", Don't throw in the sponge at round Ten. See, I've found This horse shoe. Here, loos- en your glove. To the ring, Gaun and land a good swing, It's his trapdoor and noose.
